ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I have considerably furthered my foundational skills Italian with a higher range of grammatical structures, vocabulary and comprehension.
I was better able to speak Italian.
Vocabulary, verbs, speaking
Learnt more advanced Italian

This class built upon the elementary knowledge that I gained in L1. I developed a deeper knowledge of both the italian language and italian culture. I improved my skills in reading, writing and speaking italian.
The Italian language
I learned grammar and how to read, write, and speak in Italian.

I have learned a tremendous amount by taking this course. I have learned new grammatical structures and as well as more about the culture, traditions, and history of Italy through the various units we covered. More importantly, the exercises in class have taught me learned to think in Italian and speak in Italian on my feet. This has enhanced my ability to be conversant in the language and have the confidence to speak on any topic that I would like!
I learned more advanced Italian grammar and tenses.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course is extremely well structured and the lectures were very well-delivered and interactive. The assessments throughout the course really keep you on top of everything.
I wish there was more time to review material before moving on to the next. Some units were extremely difficult and we had a very short time between the end of the unit and the test.

Strengths- the teaching 
Weaknesses- the frequency of tests
Strengths meet every day lots of time to understand and learn. Weakness expected to learn lot of vocab in our own time

The strengths of this course are that it is very well organized and its pace is manageable. This course could be better if there were not 6 exams throughout the course that occurred in short intervals.
Tests not worth enough, other items worth too much that make strangely weighted grading. Teaching was great and class was otherwise fun and beneficial.
The strengths were teaching grammar. I would have liked to do more speaking activities to prepare for the final oral exam.

Strengths: Super engaging, organized, and fun! We immersed ourselves in all forms of media, from film to music to literature, which has been instrumental in forming an effective learning environment and improving our fluency in Italian. 
Units were organized to be about a 1-1.5 weeks long and were well-paced. Weekly compositions helped improve our writing skills and encouraged us to do research on phrases and vocab not covered in class. Presentations were nice and low-key to help us practice our conversational and listening skills. Having spontaneous class discussions on relevant class material was particularly important in allowing us to think and speak on our feet, helping us sharpen our conversational skills.

Weaknesses: Some of the units had more material than others, especially the last few, so it would have been nice to split some of the units up and be tested on those heavier units half-a-unit at a time. Sometimes, we had compositions due on the same day as the unit exams, so scheduling them so that they don't conflict with each other would be helpful. Online textbook exercises were helpful for extra practice, but sometimes the feedback/grading system was not very helpful & not accurate or not sensitive to minor inaccuracies.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend this course, because the skills you will gain from the class will genuinely enable you to comprehend and communicate in Italian. I looked forward to the class everyday due to the friendly and engaging environment.
Yes.
Yes if interested in learning basic Italian
I would definitely recommend this course to any student looking to fill their language requirement. I have truly enjoyed learning more about the italian language as well as the culture.
Yes, I would. It is a fun and useful class.
Yes. I really liked learning Italian and I think it is a useful language to learn that is not too challenging.

Absolutely! If you are even remotely interested in learning Italian, take it! The faculty is incredibly supportive and committed to helping you learn the Italian language and culture and history. You will come out of the language sequence having learned beyond what you expect  you will learn about the diverse ways in which humans communicate across different cultures and in turn, learn more about your own. You will develop a globalized perspective and be more attentive to and interested in the ways in which the Italian language and culture has influence over our own communities today!
The Italian department is great and if you're going to stay with a language Italian is a great choice.
